Reviews.Title: “Great value with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed at this small hotel five times in the past four months while in Miami. Every time we have been treated with welcoming smiles, helpful and fun staff, good food, enjoyable atmosphere, and a clean room. The hotel is not a luxurious one. But we don't go to Miami to sit in a stuffy hotel and pay for pampering service. Compared to other larger brand name hotels, the value is superb!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel - priced right!”
Reviews.Author: Tomapa
Reviews.Content: Lovely three story hotel reasonably priced located in downtown. The rooms are small but well appointed. A lovely pool with fire place and cabanas. We had only breakfast in restaurant. It was very good, with friendly and efficient service. The paintings decorating walls throughout hotel are great!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Levels of Service!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony F
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had the pleasure of staying one night (February 17, 2012) at the Hotel Urbano. We opted to stay in Miami one night prior to the departure of our 7 day cruise from the Port of Miami. I must tell you that the hotel representative that checked us in was extremely helpful and service oriented. We had a chance to meet the hotel shift manager, she was also extremely helpful and service oriented. As a result of a late check-in we ate that the hotel's restaurant. We again encountered yet another friendly, service oriented employee. Unfortunately I can't recall their names, I do however hope they receive the recognition they truly deserved. Terrific hotel, very clean, highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but a bit uneven”
Reviews.Author: ManndrakeLA
Reviews.Content: Okay here's the skinny: I think this place has TREMENDOUS potential, but I don't think it's being run as well as it should. Nice property, great beds, friendly staff; it's just the logistics that mess this place up. RESERVATIONS/CHECK-IN: I made a reservation here on 1/28, after doing my homework here in the lovely TripAdvisor-land as well as Yelp. Later in the day, I saw that they had a lower special rate in celebration of their 2-yr anniversary. Made the new reservation and canceled the previous one, getting email confirmations for everything. Once I arrived at the hotel 3 weeks later, BOTH my reservations were canceled --?! The Asst. Manager had to be called in to fix the problem. After a 15-20 minute wait, he found a room. Being a former hotel employee and an avid traveler I know that when you wait for a room to become available it's either a) a room that needs housekeeping or b) a room that's been pulled from their "do not sell" repair inventory as a last resort. I believe it was the latter for us, as there were a few technical issues with our room (203), which was by the elevator and ice machine. That said, the room overall was decent. Here's the weird thing: it's not the end of the world, but even though the manager was pleasant enough, he never apologized for the mishap with the reservation or for the wait. :( PARKING: Yup. As everyone complains, parking does suck. Oh well! Even though I could've paid the $30/nt parking fee, I chose the streets. I'm used to navigating for parking as an Angeleno (LA). Keep in mind there are literally only 10-12 parking spaces available around the hotel heading north and south on SW 25th Rd and 5 spots on Miami Ave., so read the signs carefully. We saw two cars getting towed during our 3-day stay. (It is odd there's so little street parking, but the neighborhood is really nice and quiet.) I'd suggest they either reduce their fee a smidgen ($22 vs. $29) or maybe strike a deal with Miami Parking Authority for LOT #23 just a few feet away (right now I think it's registered decal-only parking). Just a thought, if the GM is reading this review. :) AMENITIES: Beautiful space! Great pool area; in fact, the pool area was the main reason I chose this hotel. Comfortable poolside seating in great condition, waterfall, firepit, cabana-style seating with flat-screens. Very nice! Though we didn't eat at the restaurant, we did order food from the bar and room service. Basic food items, mostly appetizer-type dishes (calamari, flat pizza, etc.). Rooms are tastefully decorated and fairly clean (a few noticeable scuff marks along the walls, as well as a broken bathroom door handle and minor other issues) with super comfortable bedding. Hotel has a small fitness room, but we didn't use it. STAFF: Super nice people! Doorman Jairo was awesome!! Thank you to Soy, the bartender, who has to multitask as bartender, waitress and room service attendant. Front Desk staff was friendly too, as well as the housekeepers. Asst. Manager Evan was a bit aloof, but polite. OVERALL: Like I said earlier, this place has plenty of pluses, especially its physical attributes; but for a hotel of only 60-65 rooms it should be run like a tight ship. Given they just celebrated their two year anniversary, I truly hope they'll get a better handle on things for two more years. All said, I enjoyed my visit to Miami and will def. consider returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, a nice change from the chains.”
Reviews.Author: BenAnde
Reviews.Content: This is my third time that I have stayed at Urbano. My welcome has always been friendly, never a glitch and the rooms have always been quite nice. Housekeeping, very good, same person all three visits, they remembered me as well. The restaurant has a limited menu, yet is so convenient and the chef is accommodating and talented. The entire staff is extremely courteous, friendly, and professional. The location is fantastic for my situation.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable”
Reviews.Author: eme12
Reviews.Content: Do not book a block of rooms with them. I was booking a block of rooms and they promised something they could not fulfill. This might not have been so bad if I had found that out quickly, but the woman was so hard to reach (and made it very clear she would not call outside of business hours) it took over two months before I realized she could not fulfill what she had promised. In the end, neither she or her manager sincerely apologized or offered anything to make up for it. Fortunately I found a nice nearby hotel who could follow through on their word.

Reviews.Title: “My first negative review ever...”
Reviews.Author: NYCmember
Reviews.Content: First, some context: I use TripAdvisor about twice a year to plan family vacations, once in the summer, once in the winter; as I have always stayed in highly rated properties, I havenâ€™t written a review for a couple of years, having had nothing insightful to add to the raves and thus succumbing to laziness. However, I feel compelled to detail our recent experiences at the Hotel Urbano, as it the first time I have been dissatisfied with a property for which the consensus view appeared so positive. Our family of four adults stayed at Hotel Urbano for two one-night visits. I chose this hotel because the negative comments on this site were mostly about things that did not concern me (such as the high cost of valet parking) and the positives were persuasive. The first visit, we had connecting rooms. One room, 214, was very good; the other, 215, turned out to have a nonfunctional toilet, poor water pressure in the shower and a general air of neglect. Both rooms were quite quiet despite being eye level with I-95 (the â€œcity viewâ€�), and had excellent beds; so we were content to share the toilet in room 214 and we managed just fine for the night. We decided to return for the second stay, assuming the inadequacy of room 215 was a fluke. An apologetic manager gave us vouchers for a free breakfast for that return stay as well, a level of service that also reassured us that all would be well. Unfortunately, for our second stay, we found both rooms 301 and 303 to be sub-par because of a throbbing mechanical noise. I see now that one other review has already noted this problem for room 301; similar noise was also audible in room 303, room 325 (which was offered to me as a potential switch), and also apparently in 302, as the occupant of that room came into ours to ask if we had a noise problem. It may be that sort of noise would not bother some people, but I could not get used to it and could not sleep. The water pressure in both 301 and 303 was inadequate, too. Very disappointing. I am sorry to have to give this hotel a poor rating, because the staff members were very nice, the beds are really comfortable, and the location is very convenient; if all rooms had been like 214, the venue would represent good value. But one room out of four being good is not good enough for anything better than â€œpoorâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: pghfoodie
Reviews.Content: Ok location. Clean. Decor is chic cheap. Left room at 8:30am and was not cleaned when I got back at 5. Pool is nice and there is a small fire pit. Close to key biscayne and coral gables and downtown. Like I said. Average hotel ok location

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, attentive staff, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: SandraCRS
Reviews.Content: I chose Urbano for a two night stay, after a cruise and prior to my return to Brazil.It's a small, yet quiet and well located hotel - short distance from US-1 and I-95. Staff. If you are planning on spend little time at the hotel, as we did, it is a fairly good choice. Staff was efficient, yet discrete.

Reviews.Title: “Purpose Served”
Reviews.Author: LaryS6143
Reviews.Content: I only needed the hotel for one night prior to a cruise and it served its purpose just fine. I'm not sure that I would have stayed for an extended period of time here, but it was a very eclectic mix design wise and the bistro was surprisingly good as far as hotel based restaurants are concerned. My only complaint was the karaoke that was taking place was a bit obtrusive- but when in miami or out in public I think you subject yourself to these minor inconveniences. Aside from that- I had a slight issue upon arrival- as expedia did not share with them my request for a wheelchair accessible room, but thankfully the person with whom I was dealing at the front desk took care of that right away and had a room cleaned so that I could check in and was given the accommodation I needed. It was an average hotel with above average customer service...wouldn't stay again but wouldn't dissuade anyone from it either

Reviews.Title: “An oasis on Brickell”
Reviews.Author: Nealtheseal
Reviews.Content: Was visiting with a friend of mine and he suggested this hotel. What a great find! A small boutique hotel with the artsy feel of south Miami. Very intimate but has a bar, restaurant, and a great outdoor area. It feels like an oasis in the middle of a bustling Miami. Outdoor fire pits, private cabanas with wide screen tv's, outdoor service poolside. Very relaxing. Rooms are great with docking station for my iPod. Staff was very friendly and even offered me a ride when the taxi was late, way over the top! Will definitely come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LLC469
Reviews.Content: Other then the parking this is a great place to stay. I like CLEAN and this place meets my standards. Food isn't the best but that's not what your paying for. They have a great little cozy outside area. This place is a short distance from a lot of nice places.

Reviews.Title: “First and Last”
Reviews.Author: jeneva p
Reviews.Content: upon arrival at Hotel Urbano, we were informed that the only parking available was valet parking. Valet parking at the rate of $30 per day. The front desk attendant (manager) advised us that this hotel was NON-SMOKING, however our room smelt like smoke, very unbearable. Their manager was unpleasant when we requested a room change. When I got to the podium (since there is no front desk) to request the change, there was no attendant there, and my personal information was left out on the podium where anyone could have taken it. We did not receive fresh towels everyday, the electrical sockets were limited and some were not working and some of the bulbs were blown. On a brighter note, we did receive a complimentary breakfast that was excellent. the bed (king sized) was soft and comfortable. I would not stay at Hotel Urbano again.

Reviews.Title: “Our First Time to Miami-Urbano Rocks”
Reviews.Author: T_Girl55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew into Miami for a cruise over Xmas. We stayed on Ocean Drive before the cruise and decided on the Urbano to finish our last five days in Miami. The staff, were top notch - we got to the hotel around 11 am, and were shown to our room. The hotel has a very adult feel to it - not meaning I did not see any little ones - it just has a very adult vibe. Xmas and only 5 at the beautiful pool, small, but lush. Even met one of the chefs from the Bistro - Fabian - super fellow. Art is everywhere, and the beds and walk in shower show a class above the usual boutique hotel. The taxi driver said as we got out of the cab on our first day - you are really secluded at this hotel. Totally wrong, a 6.00 cab ride takes you to Bickwell Village with some of the best restaurants and great little shops - a must see. It is hard to beat this place - and we travel a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Just don't book a room there through Booking.com”
Reviews.Author: crape_myrtle
Reviews.Content: The Urbano is a lovely hotel. However, I booked our room through booking.com, and they never actually made the reservation with the Urbano. The hotel staff were very kind and found us a room, but they told us this has been a problem with booking.com before. Design and art are a major priority at this hotel, and it shows. The room and bathroom were striking (I'm not sure I've ever stayed in a yellow bedroom) and comfortable, but not very large -- so if you need a lot of space, this may not be your favorite room. The neighborhood is quite nice and we loved being so close to the bridge to Key Biscayne as well as to downtown Miami. We were luckily able to find on-street parking for free a few blocks away, which saved us $24 in valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “urbano-excellent hospitality and service”
Reviews.Author: Carmen S
Reviews.Content: Elegant modern decor. Very Chic, yet warm. Nice Pool area. The bistro urbano located within the hotel serves a great Mojito. Highly recommend this hotel. Staff go out of their way to make your stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kc2ahl
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Urbano when we were staying in the Brickell area of Miami. From start to finish the hotel employees couldn't have been nicer or more welcoming. No question we asked was too much for these lovely people. The manager is onsite and frequently seen. She is very willing to listen to any and all suggestions. The price of the room was much better than hotels in the surrounding area but nothing was skimped upon. Prior to going we had become members of the iPrefer club (their frequent membership). This free service was supposed to get an upgraded room for the same price. Since the hotel was completely booked we were given a free drink coupon instead. We couldn't figure out what could possibly be more upgraded than the beautiful room we were given. Our room overlooked had a wrap around porch which overlooked the pool area and a highway. Despite this it was serenely quiet and with the super comfortable beds it was a good night's sleep. This hotel has a small bar that serves some lunch/snacks either off the lobby or pool side and a small restaurant with great food. There is a workout room and all equipment looks new and in good repair. All in all the only problem we had was that our stay wasn't long enough. Thank you to all at Hotel Urbano. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Normal stay - no surprises”
Reviews.Author: El_Pollito_Loco
Reviews.Content: This hotel was advertised at a very nice price and we stayed one night there. You will pay around 20-30 USD for car parking and valley service. You won't have any other way to park. The room is spacious and clean. The king size bed is enormous. I would recommend if you are short on budget or just staying in Miami for a short period of time. It can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Urbano is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ren m
Reviews.Content: I am a television producer and I took my team to Miami during the very hectic Art Basel this year. Hotel Urbano was amazing start to finish. They really worked with us to support our group in every way possible. From a great rate, to the most comfortable beds I have stayed in( and we are on the road ALOT!) to just being helpful, accommodating, and resourceful to us in every way possible. We were thrilled to include them as a location and I really look forward to returning. The hotel is a treasure, its stylish and art is everywhere but the real difference is the staff. The staff at Urbano make it possibly the best hotel experience we've had as a team- and this team is road-weary at this point. I can't recommend it highly enough. They are just wonderful people and it made the stay there all the more enjoyable. Ren Messer

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Jake F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Urbano with my girlfriend and had a great experience. The hotel was very modern and spacious, with a beautiful pool and lounge area. Our room was large and comfortable, and most importantly very clean. I'd recommend renting a car if you stay here. There are plenty of great places to go that are within a 15 or 20 minute drive, including South Beach (15 min), Key Biscayne (15 min), Coconut Grove (10 min), Bayside Marketplace (10 min), and Downtown (5 min). The hotel is also within walking distance of a great restaurant area called Mary Brickell Village.

Reviews.Title: “Far from south Miami beach but very nice, affordable and modern!”
Reviews.Author: YoungAdult
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and is exceptionally clean! Beds were really comftorable, bathrooms always clean, breakfast food was good, free wifi throughout and overall a great hotel. The only set back for us, being tourists, was the location. From south Miami beach a taxi ride is about 15 to 20 min costing approx 35 dollars. We made a few of these trips back and forth so it cost us a few bucks. If your planning to stay at the hotel or visit the nearby areas and financial district, you can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Miami-style boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: paluztv
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip in Miami this week and stayed at Hotel Urbano. I was very pleased with the style, feel, cleanliness and staff while visiting. Hotel Urbano really captures the feel and style that Miami and Miami beach have to offer. Though I didn't get to spend a lot of time there or get to use the pool, the hotel has a very inviting feel to it. The only negative thing I would have to say is when I asked the front desk about a bar to walk to, they said the closest bar was about 15 blocks. They do have a small bar at the hotel, but not really big enough for socializing. Overall though, I had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and CLEAN Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Veronika8206
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The minute we arrived at the hotel via our rented car, the guy in the front immediately greeted us. We were leaving immediately upon arriving and wanted to only drop off our bags, he suggested that we take our time and he will park the car in front of the hotel at no charge. Everyone was sooo nice. The room is great. The bed was absolutely amazing! I can confidently say it was one of the best beds I have slept on in the hotel. It was a cloud of pillows and just amazing. The room was cleaned every day, the bathroom was spotless. Towels added upon request. There is absolutely nothing wrong that I can say about this hotel, and I am extremely picky! So if you need to stay in the downtown Miami area and arent sure of which hotel to pick, go with Hotel Urbano. We also had the breakfast at the hotel on the day we were leaving, it was very good. The tip is Already included in the price, so you dont calculate anything. it was reasonable. The main highlights about the hotel are its very clean, staff is friendly, room is spotless, AND you can find parking outside of the hotel in the late evening. So you can avoid spending the parking fee if you look for a spot outside of the hotel. I would defintely go back to Urbano!

Reviews.Title: “Artsy, comfortable, well priced”
Reviews.Author: badness59
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights after taking a cruise. There was some painting/renovating going on but I felt relatively undisturbed by it. The pool area was beautiful, the complimentary business centre was unexpected and really came in handy. The staff was very nice and accomodating. I was actually able to check in at 9am (not that I was expecting this- really awesome!) coming from the Port of Miami. Bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was clean and nice- slightly strange having a sliding door, but for myself solo- this wasn't an issue for me. Room amenities like the robe and in-suite safe, pool towel, fridge- all were great. Air conditioning was excellent. All in all, a good experience- I would stay again. For travellers to Miami however, I strongly suggest you rent a car, you'll be wanting one.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Urbano for one night while on a recent business trip to Miami. Not only was the hotel an INCREDIBLE experience for the rate, but the staff was 5-star as well. I really felt like I was in a much, much more expensive hotel. In particular, my bartender Jenn Bond was one of the nicest people I have ever met on any of my business trips. Since I arrived very early, she took care of me while the staff prepared my room. Hopefully you will have the pleasure of having drinks at her bar!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Cheery0270
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel after reading the great reviews online and finding a great deal as well. The hotel is modern and clean with friendly staff who want to get to know you and make sure your stay at the hotel is a relaxing and enjoyable one. The rooms were clean and modernly decorated, and there were always refreshing drinks at the front desk after hanging out by the pool. I didn't mind that we had to drive about 15minutes to the beach, but if you are wanting a more party like atmosphere than don't stay here. We wanted the relaxing vibe at our hotel and we got it. The part my friends and I enjoyed the most was having amazing margaritas made by the wonderful bartender, Jennifer (from Canada) before heading to South Beach Miami clubs. You can't go wrong with any of her drink concoctions and fun conversation. We almost didn't even want to leave the bar and go dancing because we couldn't get enough of her drinks. If you don't stay at this hotel at least have a margarita here :) The only bad thing is how much the parking costs, but I had read a review about parking on the street around the corner in a residential part of the area and therefore avoiding paying. Good suggestion!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inesedmonton
Reviews.Content: Me and my family traveled to Miami on Aug 16-30. We had 3 separate stays at this hotel because of our cruise schedule. Staff was very friendly and always helpful. The food there was very good especially the wings. Cue was the bartender at the hotel bar. He was always cheerful and fast. Made me feel like we were at home. I think the best bartender I have ever had and we have done a lot of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “above the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: running_ricardo
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a nice hotel very well located for our needs. It is very near the Vizcaya museum and gardens, what little there is to visit in Little Havana, and the general Brickell Ave. area. The people were very accommodating, the room was pleasant, the pool area was restful. It is true that the parking charge is unnecessarily expensive, but compared to the generic hotel experience this was a welcome upgrade and worth the extra charge

Reviews.Title: “Expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: ana d
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week.Very nice,friendly staff,but they charged $ 25 dollars a day for parking,on top of the rate of the hotel.For a place in the middle of nowwhere I found it outrages,Incredible that they charge their own guests for the parking,considering that they have plenty of it.Would never stay there again,for the same price without the parking I can stay in Key Biscayne at Silver Sands in front of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: Service was fine, perhaps a little over kill with two valets. The room was great. The location was nice, but too close to the highways. The pool was very small. Only place in Miami that I could not use my cell phone - no signal. Did not like the prices for breakfast, too high.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel, although the beds were too small in the double bedroom!”
Reviews.Author: pattyJu
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice while we were in the bedroom with the king bed, bust as we were three, we were given the two beds bedroom and that was incredibly small, and i am a petite person who is complainig!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “More of a MOtel than a HOtel”
Reviews.Author: WhosShemp
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t believe that this place holds such a good reputation. This place is only acceptable as a place to lay your head down for a night before going out on a cruise or something, not for an extended stay. It most closely resembles a nicely decorated MOtel than a beautiful resort-like oasis. It resembles a Howard Johnson Hotel from the outside. But it wouldnâ€™t take much work to be what they desire to be. My major suggestion for this place is as follows: They need a manager with a strong presence to make sure everyone if properly trained and completing their duties continually. This person needs to be able to address guest concerns/questions. The current staff cannot. The place is so tiny. The manager should just be doing laps around this place and whip everyone into gear. They need to offer real food selections for lunch and dinner. Most of their current items could be prepared in an EZ bake oven (not a joke). Also, they need to drop their inflated parking charges. Hereâ€™s a more detailed description of things: Safety/Health Concerns/Security: The drinking glasses: They werenâ€™t cleaned for days. I had been drinking Coke from my drinking glass, and the maid overlooked it for a few days. Finally, I noticed my drinking glass was re-wrapped in clear plastic, like its partner glass. However, when I unwrapped the drinking glass, it had not been cleaned, just re-wrapped. I could see the Coke syrup stuck to the bottom-inside of the glass. Thereâ€™s no doubt that if I had not unwrapped this glass it would have been presented this way for the next guest. Dangerous gauntlet: This small room left no place to leave luggage. The only solution was to leave the luggage within the regular walking path to the bed, to the bathroom, and to the front door. I tripped over my own luggage several times on middle-of-the-night bathroom visits, stubbing my toe each time. So did my wife. We had no other place to put the luggage. Decapitation: The bathroom door is a slider. When you open the bathroom door, it slides to close the closet. When you close the closet, it opens the bathroom door. My wife was removing her jewelry from the closetâ€™s safe. When I exited the bathroom, the door slid open and nearly slammed into her head. I never thought that I had to be so careful opening a bathroom door. Who would? Note: the bathroom door also has no locks. Shower temperature: The shower temperature knob is not properly aligned. Sometimes â€œcoldâ€� is â€œhot.â€� Sometimes â€œhotâ€� is â€œcold.â€� Usually, the area right between hot and cold was SCALDING hot. Then, one day, we coldnâ€™t get any hot water no matter where we put the temperature knob. I complained to the front desk about this, explaining everything above. They fixed the problem so that it was back to the original problem- scalding water when you have it set for â€œbarely warm.â€� Electrical burning smell: at midnight one night, my wife and I simultaneously smelled a burning electrical smell in the room. I went to the front desk to report the issue. The woman at the desk called security. I walked back to my room and saw security browsing the internet on the lobby computer. I asked him if he was security. He followed me to my room, and sniffed around like a bloodhound. He said that it was nothing. The woman from the front desk followed. She said that if it gets worse to tell her and sheâ€™d switch my room. I know there was a bit of a language barrier with the security guard, but as he left the room, he literally said, â€œBe quiet. Itâ€™s nothing.â€� He said it with a smile on his face, but the words themselves were quite rude. Temperature: Sneaky Sneaky Thermostats: This thermostat has motion sensors. When youâ€™re out of the room, itâ€™s not keeping it cool for you. Also, when youâ€™re sleeping, it shuts off when it doesnâ€™t detect movement. I read the manual for this thermosat to learn how to bypass these features. Press the â€œpowerâ€� and the â€œcoolerâ€� button simultaneously and it will bypass these features for 48 hours. Also, thereâ€™s no doubt in my mind that this thermostat lied about the temperature by about 5 degrees. After reading the manual, I found that the thermostat actually does not begin blowing cold air again until the temperature is â€œoffâ€� by 4 degrees. In other words, if you set the thermostat for 65 degrees (the minimum), the air wonâ€™t start blowing until it reaches 69 degrees. Take into consideration the fact that the thermostat lies about the temperature, this means that the temperature gets to nearly 75 when you set it for 65. Thatâ€™s not my idea of comfort. The pool is too warm. Feels like a hot tub (not much of a complaint, I know). Hidden Fees: Parking: Parking is $25 + tax. $30 per day total. Too much money. I donâ€™t care if everyone in Miami charges for parking. That doesnâ€™t make it right. I was informed of street parking somewhere in the area. This street parking was impossible to find. Donâ€™t bother. I asked the valet the following question: â€œIf I find street parking one day, how does the hotel know that I did not park the car using the $30 valet service?â€� The valet didnâ€™t understand. â€œIn other words, today is Monday, suppose that I want to park in the street on Tuesday. What time do I need to get my car out of the valet and drag it out to the street to avoid the parking charges.â€� He responded by telling me that he doesnâ€™t know the answer to my question. I then asked how they figure out who is in the lot and should be charged each day. He said, â€œWe count the keys at midnight.â€� I responded, â€œSo at midnight are you charging me for Monday or for Tuesday?â€� He didnâ€™t know the answer. â€œComplimentary Continental Breakfastâ€�: We booked a package which included this. However, itâ€™s a scam. It covers a bagel or muffin, and a juice. However, there is then a service charge which is just about what it costs to buy a bagel, a muffin, and juice. Iâ€™m not exactly sure what a service charge is. The tip? Either way, the waitress told me that my â€œComplimentary Continental Breakfastâ€� would cost me $2.50. If you find the right waitress, they will actually take your complimentary continental breakfast card and apply $10 to each of your meals from the real breakfast menu. However, she will make it clear that theyâ€™re not supposed to do that. I actually had a pretty good breakfast when I found someone who would do this. For my wife and I, it totaled only about $10 after tip- and we ate pancakes and juevos rancheros. Incompetence: Upon checking in, Nelson gave me our â€œcomplimentary continental breakfastâ€� card. He gave me only one card. I said to him, â€œDoesnâ€™t my wife need one too?â€� He told me that the card is good for two people, though it doesnâ€™t say that anywhere. I triple confirmed this with him. Can you guess what happened the first morning? Fast forward to the next day. I asked Nelson why the complimentary continental breakfast card stated that itâ€™s not good for room service, yet his said differently upon checking in. He said that he would check on it. He disappeared. Literally, he disappeared for the rest of the day without responding to me. I was waiting by his desk. Luckily, someone else (who also didnâ€™t know the answer) was able to address me and roll her eyes at the fact that Nelson had done a disappearing act. The woman at the counter had to ask a waitress if the card applied to room service, and I found out that the answer is, â€œIt depends on who the waitress is.â€� Iâ€™m not exactly sure how you find that bit of information out when you call for room service the next morning, nor am I sure I understand why this is my responsibility. We just decided that weâ€™d eat elsewhere. The maid was not returning our pool towels regularly after taking the dirty towels. Thereâ€™s signs that missing towels will cost you $30 or so. I called the front desk to explain that I need these replaced and shouldnâ€™t be charged. She said sheâ€™d send some towels down instantly. However, an hour and a half later there were not towels delivered to my room. I stopped by the front desk and she told me that they were drying my towels and sheâ€™d deliver them to the pool for me. I heard another story from someone who did not have their towels replaced and the maid pulled a disappearing act when she agreed to replace the towels. This hotel boasts of a beautiful fire pit that resides outside near the pool. I never saw it lit, not once in our weekâ€™s stay. One night, I asked Nelson if he could light it for me. He had to call for backup- a manager who never responded to his radio calls. I realized this was a lost cause, so I asked the bartender. He was very friendly, and said heâ€™d light it for me. We walked outside together. He brought a remote control and bbq lighter. He tooled around for about five minutes, with me standing three feet behind him. He stated, â€œIt worked for an hour yesterday,â€� and he retreated inside. He never came back out to try again, sent someone else back out, apologized, or explain that he gave up, nothing. He just pulled a disappearing act. Ask the girl behind the bar what the price of a glass of Scotch is, sheâ€™ll say â€œI donâ€™t know. Iâ€™m not the bartender.â€� Ask the guy at the front desk a front desk related question and he will tell you he doesnâ€™t know because heâ€™s the valet. Overbooking?: While I was staying in this hotel, many were complaining that they were overbooked and they were â€œbumpedâ€� from the hotel. I must say, the place was EMPTY every day except for the last of our stay when a conference was there. The dates in which the â€œoverbookedâ€� parties were supposed to have stayed at the hotel were completely EMPTY. I would be surprised if there were ten rooms booked in the hotel until five days later. For me, this actually made for some very peaceful time at the pool. But those other people got the short end of the stick. Housekeeping: I explained the towel and drinking glasses already, but thereâ€™s more to say. First, she disregards the â€œdo not disturbâ€� sign and knocks anyway. I had a can of soda explode in the fridge and I cleaned it myself using one of the washcloths. It looked really nasty. I guess thatâ€™s why the maid left it on my bathroom floor for two days. No backup toilet paper left in the room. Headboard had someoneâ€™s â€œheadgreaseâ€� on it. Food: Good breakfast menu. However, there are only 5 things on the menu for lunch and dinner, and they are all what you would consider finger food or appetizers: Caesar salad, flatbread pizza, wings, coconut chicken, jalapeno poppers, calamari fritters, and a shrimp roll. Make a dinner out of that! There is absolutely nothing else on the menu. The menu has recently been scaled down. There is no â€œchefâ€� here. Only â€œcooks.â€� Big difference. Room accommodations: This hotel does not come close to offering the accommodations of any three star hotel I have ever visited. We paid for the largest upgrade available, the â€œKing Lanai.â€� The room boasted of a private deck with deck furniture, and direct access to the pool, fire pit, and cabanas. You couldnâ€™t sit on the private deck. It was in desperate need of an umbrella. The room was tiny. Too small for a king-sized bed. There is no place to put your luggage so that it is out of the way. You have no choice but to put it on the floor. No luggage stand, though some of the standard rooms do have this. Ours didnâ€™t, nor was there room for one. We had to put our stuff right in our walking path. The closet has a safe in it that is mounted a foot off the ground, so you canâ€™t put the bags in there. There are only three SMALL draws, so you canâ€™t even unpack more than a dayâ€™s worth of clothes. You have no choice but to live out of your suitcase- which youâ€™ll trip over. The bathroom is not large. Thereâ€™s no wonder why telephone representatives do not disclose the square footage of the room. It barely fits the bed. Sound: Room refrigerator can be loud with a high-pitched sound. Air conditioner can sometimes sound like a faucet dripping. If youâ€™re on the first floor, you will hear people in the hallway during conferences (at about 8am). You can also hear some lobby noise and pool noise- but itâ€™s faint. Overall, not a tremendous issue here. Attention to detail: I hate toilets that have the wrong shaped toilet seat for the bowl. Round toilets should have a round seat, not an oval one. If you think this is trite, try sitting on the wrong shape and get back to me. It dramatically decreases the open space in which you can do your business. Televisions in the two outdoor cabanas often times do not work, nor is there a remote control to use. You have to stand on a chair and play with the cable box, usually to find out that itâ€™s not working. Outdoor lights, which are on â€œstakesâ€� in the concrete, are crooked and unsightly. Straws, bottle caps, leaves, all over the pool deck, and even in the pool- yet thereâ€™s nobody in this place to even be creating this mess. Waitress service: Nobody comes outside to see if I want a drink while in the pool or sunbathing. Itâ€™s not uncommon for me to drop $50 poolside. They should try to make a few dollars through service, not from nickel and diming me on parking. Decorations: Decorated with that â€œart-deco, ultra-modern, Sohoâ€� styled furniture. I happen to find this type of furniture to look cold and uninviting. The valet stand smell like unlit marijuana. Itâ€™s not the bushes (like he told me). Itâ€™s marijuana. The manager should get out from hiding, make him walk a beat from the valet stand to the front desk, to the bar, to the restaurant, to the pool area. Itâ€™s so small, this is probably about fifteen steps in each direction. Someone needs to properly train the staff, be available to address guestsâ€™ questions, and to hold staff accountable for sub-par service.

Reviews.Title: “LITTLE BUT VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: cpazmino
Reviews.Content: Little hotel and rooms. Just renovated. It has nice details. Very comfortable beds. With quick access to the main roads in Miami to the south and also to the north.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, would be back in a second”
Reviews.Author: AlbadaJelgersma
Reviews.Content: Nice refurbished and upgrade hotel. Still you can still see some of the old in/exterieur. Lot's of art, nice garden with swimmingpool and cabanas. Food is good but designated space is not really a restaurant. But you can eat at bar or outside. valet parking is way too expensive. 30 dollars a night. You should use taxi or car to go into town. But nice hotel with nice bedroom and amenities. Thx for hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel accommodations with a top-notch staff”
Reviews.Author: MNMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Urbano for nine nights. From the moment we arrived, we knew we had found a great option for future stays in the Miami area. We have traveled extensively to many types of hotels and the Urbano now rates as one of our favorites. The staff is incredible. We were always greeted warmly at the front door and by the staff assisting at the front desk and at the bar. There was a timely and friendly response to any requests we made during our stay. We really enjoyed relaxing at the bar and poolside throughout our stay because the hotel feels like a calm oasis. We met other travelers who also shared their delight in having found this place. Victoria and Aaron at the bar and Alicia, Nelson and Marcia at the front desk offered helpful advice including places to go during our stay. As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel is in a residential area and is not convenient for walking to restaurants. It is, however, convenient for driving short distances to restaurants in Brickell and to the South Beach area. After spending a day at the public beach (not overly crowed the weekend we were there...and a very pleasant experience) and eating at a South Beach restaurant (restaurants lining the road in front of the beach are ridiculously expensive and have a carnival-like atmosphere with proprietors calling out "deals" to entice customers), we were happy to be returning to our hotel away from the fun but crazy atmosphere of South Beach. Other things to consider when booking this hotel include the fact that although the shower is large and the bathroom space is more than adequate, there is no tub. The restaurant breakfast menu is fabulous with huge portions and decent prices but the lunch/dinner menu is a short list of bar food - very good bar food but not a lot of options. However, we felt perfectly comfortable ordering food to be delivered from area restaurants to our poolside table at the end of the day. Others did this as well. In summary, this is the kind of hotel where you will find yourself feeling very much "at home" with comfortable accommodations and an extremely kind and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jogarna
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything I thought it would be. The hotel room was really nice, clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The facilities were amazing: pool, bar, restaurant, fitness... The only drawback is that it is a little bit further (more than I thought) from the center and Miami beach. For sure I would recommend to rent a car if you are staying at the hotel, which is actually needed in any case if you are staying in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KathyViajes
Reviews.Content: We got married in March in Miami in Vizcaya Gardens and trying to find a place nearby for us and some of the guests. Everybody loved the rooms, beds were comfrotable, rooms were big, didn't feel noise, breakfast was good. The art in the walls was a nice touch.They have a lovely pool and a terrace where you can have drinks with friends if you want and was great for some of the pre wedding pictures. The staff was very helpful in our last minute requests. This hotel was excellent, it is a bit expensive but one of the best options in the area. Parking is easy and I'm not sure what I think it's close of the metro station (10 or 15 minutes). We would definetely go back!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel”
Reviews.Author: marybeth1211
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hotel Urbano for two nights before taking off on a cruise. I have worked in hotels and I am a very picky hotel person so that being said I did a lot of research before choosing the Hotel Urbano. I liked the price, the location and the art boutique theme, and I was not at all disappointed upon check in. The best part of this hotel is the staff, everyone is VERY friendly and very polite. We were checked in promptly, our room was ready, and our car was parked for us. Yes you do have to pay for the valet every night but it really is the safest and easiest way to have a car and stay here. The room was spacious and beautiful. Tastefully decorated and the bed was SOOO comfortable. The bathroom was a great size - we did not have a tub in our bathroom so if you are someone who likes a bath double check this when you make your reservation. There were pool towels in the bathroom and everything was clean which is something I automatically check. We had a couple of cocktails by the pool and Robert was excellent - he made my fiance a delicious pina colade, had him try it first to make sure it was good. We also had appetizers one night also out by the pool and they were very good. Breakfast might have been my absolute favorite part. Everything was cooked fresh and it was sooooooooo good. I highly recommend the huevos rancheros - I can still taste them now. The art decorating the hotel's hallways is also well worth a look, there are some very interesting and lovely pieces and it really makes the hotel that much lovelier. I have to say I enjoyed my stay so much that I was really disappointed to leave and even more so when I saw my accommodations on the cruise ship. Should I ever go back to Miami I would not stay anywhere else - LOVE this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little gem!”
Reviews.Author: igripirip
Reviews.Content: Got and in late to Miami and were amazed at how our hotel was able to pick up our spirits. From the friendly workers to the fascinating collection of art (which we were told changes every quarter) it was evident that this hotel was extremely well run. The next time we are in Miami, we will with out a doubt come back and stay at Urbano! We loved everything about it, including to little manatee welcoming us after a long, hard day of travel. The pool was amazing, surrounded by several cabanas and the friendly bartender kept us laughing after our swim. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: jmusman
Reviews.Content: Room 301 is one of the worst I've been in a hotel. It's all weared. Tha carpet and couch stained. The noise of a pump or engine or compressor halts you every minute and makes dificult to sleep. For less you can get a much better hotel in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back!”
Reviews.Author: iam72
Reviews.Content: Try to imagine anything that can go wrong while traveling with nyour family on vacation in a hotel. We had 2 days reservations early July and after 2 weeks at Urbano's while in Miami. In our first stay, we had issues with the check in, while they said the check in time was at 3pm, we arrived 3:45 and they told us they didnt have any room available and we had to wait 1 hour to get our room. Then when we tried to shower at night, there was not water pressure in shower. The next morning we complained and they promissed to have mantainance to check it, when we got back at night, what a surprise! we had to shower with help of plastci cups as there was still no water pressure. Next morning was even worst, and when mantainance came, they told us we had to use another bathroom in another room... When we left, my husband complained to the general manager and asked to get us special attention as we would be back in 2 weeks... What a surprise when we got back, the doorman already told us there was some issues with our reservations... they have olversold the rooms and when we got there at 8pm with 2 little kids ready to take a shower and go to bed, and no room available!! they offered us a "sister" hotel near dadeland... which is 30 minuts by car... We said we couldnt as our whole family lives in Brickell ave and that was the whole point to stay at their hotel, to be at that specific location. We asked for any hotel at brickell and they wouldnt do anything, just the old same lime "we understand... no sir, you do not understand as you havent been travleing with 2 kids. The only thing we need a hotel to have is: good shower, clean sheets and good staff. The hotel failed in this 3 basics requests. We had to solve our own problem calling the Marriot hotel and getting ourselves another reservation and they will pay for the one night. Even so, we will have to wait 7 days to get a check in the mail... and how sure can we be that they will even do that? will update the post if we dont get it.. thats for sure! The lesson they should leanr is to focus on basics that the hotel should have and not in happy houirs, bar man, decorations... this is not your core business. and I do not think they will be in business for too long if they keep doing things this way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Art boutique Miami hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miami_traveler2011
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. Both times having a great stay. Good value considering the area. Friendly staff. Great bartender Jeffrey. Everyone made sure I was taking care of. Thanks for the great stay highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoughboroughRachel52
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Urbano after reading reviews on trip advisor and we weren't disappointed. We stayed at the Urbano for 3 nights before setting off for Key West. We booked directly with the hotel and got an excellent rate, the stay was excellent value for money. The hotel is clean and modern with a lovely pool area. The room and bathroom was clean and relatively big. The staff were really friendly and efficient. The hotel is a really good base if for site seeing in Miami as it is very near the highways, it is a 20 minute drive to South Beach and about 10 minutes to Coral Gables and Coconut Grove. These are all areas which I would recommend that you visit whilst in Miami. On our first night in Miami we went to Mary Brickell Village which is about a 5 minute drive from the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in this area and the atmosphere was really good. We had an excellent mexican meal at the Rosa Mexicana, the guacamole was amazing and they had a separate gluten free menu which was a novelty for me as I generally struggle when eating out to know what I can eat. If you stay at the hotel you will definitely need a car, the valet parking is expensive at the hotel but we were aware of this before we booked. There is a car park near by which looked to be cheaper but we were nervous as it wasn't secure. I would fully recommend staying here, couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Feel - Lovely Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: randalen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Urbano based on the good reviews on Trip Advisor. I was very pleased with the hotel and the location to our local office. Rooms were clean, staff friendly, and pool area had a resort feel. I booked the pool view and was glad I did! The only downside was the price of parking and coffee. The first day I ordered an iced latte to go, but didn't realize it would be over $6 until it was already made. I stuck with cafe con leches from down the street for the rest of the week I will definitely stay here again when I visit Miami on business!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a quiet location..”
Reviews.Author: nibbler99
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after flying in from New York, it was a special trip for my birthday. On arrival we were given our room, we requested a double, quiet room overlooking the pool. We did not get this, it was a twin and overlooking the road, after speaking to Nelson on Reception and saying that this is not what we had requested he kindly spoke to the Manager who changed our room to a king size, overlooking the pool and we were very pleased with this. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean and quiet compared to the hotel stay in New York. Air con was quiet too. Service was ok, didnt start off well as the girl in the restaurant was very slow at serving on the first day and got mixed up with what we had ordered. Jenny, however was very efficient and friendly and found her to be very good. Aarron also was very friendly and helpful and said that if we had any questions on where to go to ask him. Location wise we were aware that it was a bit 'out of the way' but we had hired a car, and would highly recommend doing this as you can get around much easily plus parking is a bit on the dear side at $24 + tax. We knew this would be the case before we went after reading other peoples reviews. It is nice being just out of the thick of it but still be a stones throw away from the hustle and bustle of downtown. We managed to park off street parking apart from the first day. We got to go to Coral Gables, The Keys and Key Biscayne, all well worth a visit. The Mary Brickell Village is near and handy for breakfast and slightly cheaper that the hotel. Food wise the hotel was good albeit a bit pricey but I think that is the norm with Miami. Service could of been better at the hotel but improved towards the end of our weeks stay, we did find that in general Miami's service wasnt the fastest apart from the more expensive establishments. I would definitely recommend this hotel and the pool area is so nice and tranquil.

Reviews.Title: “Little Boutique Hotel! Unique experience! Recommended~”
Reviews.Author: qzhever
Reviews.Content: Great location: close to downtown but also easy to get to from the airport . This hotel is very different from other chain hotels! The decoration paintings in the lobby and hallway are artistic. The swimming pool is beautiful with beach-like atmosphere. During cool evenings, you can lean on the comfortable outdoor couches while listening to music. They have a cozy restaurant which opens till late in the evening. The food and service are both decent, thought there is not much choice. The guest room is also comfortable with large bath room and almost everything a tired and forgetful traveler would hope for! As for parking, you can find free on-street parking, if you are lucky.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: cheryltoh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Urbano for two day in May with two other friends. The hotel was obviously new, well furnished and well-maintained. The beds were large enough and very comfortable and the bathrooms were clean with fresh towels provided everyday. The safe provided was an added bonus. Most importantly, free wifi was provided, and for those without a laptop/smartphone, there is always there are computers on the first floor available for use. The Mary Brickell Village was considerably nearby and does have a collection of lovely eateries. However, I would not recommend this hotel for its location. Although it is situated in downtown miami, it is not within walking distance to anything nearby. We did not rent a car and was thinking of traveling around by the metrobuses or trains. However, that did not work out and we ended up taking taxis around due to the irregularity of the public transportation. Also, the hotel staff (especially the front desk), were not particularly knowledgable about the area. We noticed that there were bus stops just outside of the hotel, however when we asked the staff at the front desk about it they claim that they do not know about it. Also, there was a humming sound on and off, possibly from the pipes, which was rather distracting to fall asleep to. (we were situated on the third floor..) Otherwise, the nice room aside, the food was also great and we received excellent service from the waiter at the Bistro (i think his name was aaron..) and the pool area was lovely as well (do beware of the mosquitoes in the summer though).

Reviews.Title: “Looks like a good hotel, but they want to charge everything!”
Reviews.Author: lcosta27
Reviews.Content: I am going to stay there on June, booked the hotel because of the good reviews, but found out later, that they charge $24 for the valet parking, and also, after calling the frontdesk, they informed me that they want charge about $7 A NIGHT to keep packages sent to the hotel before the guest arrives. This is the first hotel EVER that charged me for something like this! I'm not from the USA, but I travel often to Miami. I stay for like 2 or 3 days, so everything I want to buy, I have to buy from the Internet and get it delivered to the hotel, because I have no time to go out and buy it. If they want to charge for something like that, I'm definately not staying there again. And I would not recommend for people that does the same.

Reviews.Title: “no surprises...has maintained and offers overall excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: szur
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Hotel Urbano before and experienced once again a consistently high level of professional services and accomodations! great cocktails food and service! not always the case , esp. in Miami! have recommended it to friends and they agreed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, cleanand welcoming. Staff very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Crocombes
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Urbano at 10am after a very early flight from New York. Having emailed the hotel before our trip to inquire if they had a luggage store (prompt helpful reply) we arranged to leave our luggage and return at check in time. As we were very tired after flying from the UK the previous day, we were offered a room there and then. We decided however to wait for a room with a balcony. The room was spotlessly clean with all the amenities advertised. Some previous reviews stated the pool was small. The hotel itself is not large so the pool size is more than adequate for the amount of guests staying there. The staff are very polite, helpful and nothing was to much trouble. Breakfast menu is varied, reasonably priced and enjoyable. Evening menu was ok, we ate in the hotel the first evening but found nicer restaurants near by. The location of the hotel is a little out of the way, nesesetating taxi rides to most places. The Mary Brickell Village is within walking distance and has some very nice shops and eateries. Overall our stay was very enjoyable and I would recommend the Hotel Urbano to anyone wishing to stay in Downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay but remote”
Reviews.Author: urbandivaLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights before getting on a cruise. The room was OK though there was a constant buzz so I slept with ear plugs. The location is remote so you need a car though you can walk to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “too bad that the food was so mediocre”
Reviews.Author: JeanMichel
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel although somewhat remote - Upon arrival, staff was attentive and helpful. The room was very attractive and comfortable. The TV was limited to a few channels with no movies - I really expected with this level of interior decorating and details of comfort that this service (pay per view etc) would obviously be available. High speed Internet was working fine. The good feeling ended when I went to the restaurant - I had arrived late and was tired from a long trip, not wanting to take a cab to go out - The server didn't know if you could order the lunch menu after 5 and I had to go and ask the cook myself. Realizing that I was not going to get any service from the restaurant's staff, I decided to head for the bar where I ordered a simple burger and fries from the menu that I picked up and wasn't offered- The barman was very professional and after a couple of drinks, the food arrived. The cook managed to deliver a super dry piece of meat with soggy fries that were cooked in luke warm oil - Next day, breakfast same again, lousy service and terrible food. Management must be blind not to see that real croissant (Chez Paul Bakery) and some fresh squeezed orange juice, not the stuff called "fresh squeezed" out of a bottle would go such a long way to get repeat customers. I would like to come back to this hotel, but as it stands, I will not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - expected more”
Reviews.Author: Dado_de_Castro
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in Miami with my wife. Big rooms, nice bathrooms. Could have a larger staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: JLK9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night at the Hotel Urbano, on our way to the Everglades and Key West. The hotel was very convenient to find and while it was just off a freeway, the rooms were very quiet. The highlight, however, was how friendly the entire staff was--from the valet attendant to the desk clerk to the waitress at breakfast. Based on a suggestion from the desk clerk, we ventured into Little Havana for dinner--great Cuban food and just the atmosphere we were after. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller00031
Reviews.Content: A really very nice hotel, i find it very clean and in an interesting area Brikell is a perfec place for have everything, the pool of the hotel is so nice,i didnt do but i saw some peoples use the pool till very late in the night, and the rooms very confortable and very clean,i been there a week last jun and i think i will back in this hotel next time i will be in Miami

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but couldnt sleep and nothing within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: wilhornis
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks good. However, they couldnt find our reservation upon checkin, probably because we booked it through booking.com the day before. We were give the room right around the corner of the lobby. Though no balcony and on the streetside, it looked good, but during the night it turned out to be a nightmare, as it was next to a staff room/back office of the front desk. Stafff was walking in and out, and everytime the door slammed. Next day upon checkout i complained, and they apologized and said they could have given us another room, but thats not something i want in the middle of the night with a sleepy head. But would definitely changed rooms if we would have stayed more than one night. Not enough staff to serve the bar and restaurant, do room service, so had to wait long. However, except for the urbano fries, the food is good. Fortunately, as there are no other dining options within walking distance. Pool is small, sun beds are a bit sticky, but ok. Wouldnt recommend for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Hotel Urbano”
Reviews.Author: kmarieg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urbano offers more than any guest could ask for! I've never experienced such a friendly and welcoming staff willing to go above and beyond for their guests. Sitting by the pool was very relaxing and the food was excellent! It was my first time visiting Miami and I will definitely book with Hotel Urbano next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: katiemw
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Urbano on TripAdvisor and booked a room for a couple girlfriends and I for a much needed long weekend in Miami. As the one who picked the room I was a bit nervous, as my girlfriends can be hard to please (as can I!). My worries were definitely unfounded. From the moment we stepped in to the lobby we knew that we had made the right choice. The hotel is not only immaculate, but beautiful! The art was literally stunning, and I heard someone say they change it out quarterly. We were so happy with the room. It was clean and bright, and plenty of space in the bathroom for all of our "stuff". After we got settled we hit the pool. It was great! Nice-sized pool, clean pool deck, and lots of places to lounge in and out of the sun. The food there was NOT your typical hotel food either. It was delicious. The thing that most impressed me was the staff. The front desk staff, the bar staff, the housekeeping staff - everyone was friendly, accomodating, and personable! I have stayed in hotels before where the staff is disgruntled and seem to rather be anywhere but there. However, at the Urbano they truly seemed like they enjoyed being at work and it really showed. It is rare that my girlfriends and I get the chance to get a weekend away together, and it was so nice to do so and so nice to stay in such a great hotel. Next time in Miami I will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Collie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 week, staff were very friendly and polite. Hotel was very clean. Made our stay very special. Price was very reasonable Planning to go again in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Unique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: belliott009
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay in the larger cookie-cutter/chain hotels and staying at the Hotel Urbano for 4 days was a very refreshing experience. The personal service is outstanding, from the valet guys (Gabriel) to the bartenders (Aaron), you feel like the entire staff is working for you, the guest. As far as the rooms, we had a top floor room with a balcony overlooking the pool area. We also had a pretty good view of some of the downtown Miami skyline, which was nice. Everything inside the room was very modern and well kept. Looking forward to staying at Hotel Urbano again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Can we go back?”
Reviews.Author: Jamesk6755
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our one night stay at Hotel Urbano and we are now counting down the days till we go back. First, we arrived in Miami from our cruise ship on early Monday morning. To our delight, the hotel attendant was empathetic and he was able to accommodate our early check-in request. We spent the rest of our time laying by the pool and in the comfortable cabanas. The service from the waiters was outstanding. We felt like we were right at home! We are planning another trip to Miami in August. We will surely stay at this hotel again and for a longer duration. I can't wait to go back to Miami (beautiful city) and Hotel Urbano so we can lay in the Cabanas with a cocktail!

Reviews.Title: “Smart smart, good pool and location, not very cheap”
Reviews.Author: happy_riad_fan
Reviews.Content: The Urbano is an easy 15 minute drive from South Beach, but is located in Miami, on the mainland, in a quiet and tree-lined residential area but close to major freeways. The rooms at Urbano are very nice, with a big comfy bed, a huge plasma TV and a smart bathroom, and arty pictures and sculptures dotted around the rooms, corridors, pool and lobby. The TV in the room has an HDMI socket, so if you have an HDMI cable you can play DVDs on your laptop and watch them on the TV :-) The only complaint about the room would have been that the elevated freeway went right past our window - but then we didn't spend that much time in the room looking out the window so it didn't affect us too much :-) There's a very smart, chic bar area downstairs and free wifi. The pool itself is quite pretty, with a nice water fall feature that manages to mostly screen out the sound of the freeway, and private cabanas available. The rates don't seem to include breakfast, though, and there's only valet parking, so overall it's not a very cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in residential area.”
Reviews.Author: licocori
Reviews.Content: I was attending a hotel conference (HOLA) at the Marriott Marquis and decide to stay there. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Rooms and clean and modern. Bathroom is spacious with nice shower. Nice desk with good Internet connection. Nice decoration in lobby and common areas of the hotel. Only had chance to use bar in the evening and drinks and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!!! All you need for your stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Foquitraveler
Reviews.Content: I came to Miami with my husband for 4 days and we stayed at this fantastic little hotel. Our purpose was to rest and shopping and we found exactly what we needed. The rooms are perfect and the beds very very comfortable. All is clean and the "art" decoration is very pleasant. The swimmingpool is not big but fantastic. Food is great as well. We were worried because we had a rental car and we didn't want to pay for Valet Parking but nearby the hotel we found plenty of little streets where to park without a problem. We are defenitely going to come back here next time we need to visit Miami for work or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_kc
Reviews.Content: Great location, a block from the highway and causeway. (Ask for a room that doesnt face it otherwise it can get a bit noisy). The hotel is about 10-15 mins from the Tennis Center and about a 15-20 minute walk from restaurants in downtown. The rooms don't have any views to speak of but it is very comfortable and modern. The restaurants in the hotel itself are excellent if you dont want to walk downtown. There's a guy sitting in one of the conference rooms selling tickets to sporting events if you want to attend. You have to pay for parking ($24/night). Nice swimming pool. The staff is curteous. The business center is not much to speak of. There are a couple of computers but that is about it. There's an ATM on location. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff I have ever met!”
Reviews.Author: Pandabearjohnson
Reviews.Content: I had to come to Miami for one day for business and I wanted a hotel close to downtown but I didn't want to pay $400 to stay at the Conrad and I didn't want to pay $120 to stay at a crappy Days Inn, so (thanks to Trip Advisor) I found the Urbano. Wow, what a great hotel. I arrived just before the kitchen closed and the staff knocked themselves out to make sure I got my food. The next morning the staff were very helpful about everything. More than helpful, I got the feeling that the managers at the Urbano managed to create a really tight team that included everyone from the doormen to the night bartender to the cooks to the front desk staff. I know how hard it can be to build a service team like that so I really appreciated it. My only regret is that I was traveling by myself and I couldn't share this great little hotel with my wife. After my business meeting I took a dip in the pool which has been done very nicely. Also, the bartender made me the best Manhattan I have ever had. This is one of the few hotels I actually look forward to going back to. Thanks Urbano Team

Reviews.Title: “Appalling rudeness and service, DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Alexmax0420
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival at the hotel, i was brusquely informed that my hotel room was unavailable and there was littlw they could do. After much persuading they finally agreed to pay for us to sleep at another hotel (it was nearly 12 by the time we left Urbano. Unfortunately we had three more nights at the hotel urbano, and the rudeness, carelessness, and poor service was the rule rather than the exception. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous staff and a welcoming environment”
Reviews.Author: 154954Ron
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at the Urbano and felt very welcome from the day we arrived. Many evenings were spent in the pool area around the firepit. The bar staff and retaurant staff were very helpful and accomodating. The room was clean and comfortable and the balcony on poolside was great to enjoy the morning sun. The rate seemed to be reasonable compared to other Miami locations but be sure to ask about all applicable taxes and fees before you book your stay. The fitness facility was very comfortable with a great view although some of the equiptment such as heart rate monitors and mounted TVs did not work.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: kalex707
Reviews.Content: The BEST hotel experience I've probably ever had. We had so much fun getting to know the employees while drinking mimosas and eating yummy food. Seriously everyone on staff made us feel so at home. Rooms were luxurious. I slept so well. Loved the pool and outdoor seating! We'll be back! U were all great especially evan m and jen!!!!! Wish we could've kidnapped u to keys with us.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: volpesjr
Reviews.Content: Small, clean,and very central to all Miami. At the time the price was great.

Reviews.Title: “retro miami gem!”
Reviews.Author: szur
Reviews.Content: recently stayed overnight here. The hotel is very cool, great location, small and detailed oriented.. Fabulous artwork throughout hotel, delicious drinks, although it did take awhile for bartender to appear! Room service was efficient , coffee and breakfast delicious! Great neighborhood ...will stay again !

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL URBANO A TRUE GEM....SPARKLING”
Reviews.Author: suzanna46
Reviews.Content: Sparkling clean, staff very friendly-excellent help, room..very very clean, nice size/decor , lovely pool and common areas, location great, art filled, free internet, expensive valet parking.All in all ..should be four star.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: zenhaus
Reviews.Content: What a find! Hotel Urbano is a great place to stay in Miami. The service alone is far above and beyond it's star quality level. The staff went out of their way, in nearly all cases, to provide a comfortable stay. High regard goes to bartenders Robert and Jeffrey, server Melissa from Costa Rica and the valet doormen who opened the door with a smile every time. The rooms are large, clean and very comfortable. I stayed on the side facing Brickell Ave. and hardly heard the traffic noise at night. The pool area, with it's lounge chairs, fire pit and TV cabana's is relaxing, although the weather wasn't warm enough for me to really enjoy it. The hotel is located just outside of the downtown area in a nice residential area. It's a 5-minute drive or about a 30-minute walk to bridge around Miami River Walk. Valet parking at the hotel is expensive at $24, which is to be expected at a city hotel, but is completely avoidable in my opinion. The area seemed really safe (joggers running by at most times of day, even after dark), street parking is free as long as you pay attention to the signs. I parked across Brickell Ave. in the dead-end part of SE 25th Rd. with no problems. If you're considering a trip to Miami and want to stay downtown or near it, I highly recommend Hotel Urbano.

Reviews.Title: “"Customer Service" rating perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: Jbrediger1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a Redeye flight out of Seattle got into Miami around 11:00am . After an exhausting flight we decided to goto the hotel and see if we could check in. The Hotel front desk CUSTOMER SERVICE AGENT was able to get us into our room even after they had a full booking the night before. The Hotel Urbano went above and beyond to ensure we could get into our room. Any other large National Change Hotel would have said "Sorry check in later" I want to commend the Girl at the Front desk Virgina , she definately exceeded my Expectations ... So when you are looking for a Hotel, make this your first Choice. Thanks....Jake....Seattle, WA

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Service Excellence”
Reviews.Author: DPSandDots
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending two nights at Hotel Urbano this month. We highly recommend it! The location is at the beginning of Brickell, just north of the Biscayne/Vizcaya entrance. The neighborhood is residential, and it was perfect for us as we had a family event up the street. From the moment we pulled in, to our checkout, the service was exceptional, from management, bellmen, and housekeeping. The hotel staff is warm and inviting, professional and experienced. The hotel is a boutique, with about 60 rooms on 3 floors, a lounge and restaurant in the lobby, pool and terrace with cabanas, and tropically lit at nite to sit around their fire pit; a fitness room with some machines and weights, a business area with terminals and a printer, and free wifi in the rooms. The king size bed was fabulous, with overstuffed down blankets and a rollaway that was comfortable for our 7 year old son. All the furniture was new. They even provide large pool towels. Breakfast was table service and featured gourmet omelettes, bagels, pastries, granola, cereal, and other options. There is artwork everywhere, on every floor and hallway, very cool deco prints. The front desk was most accommodating, and genuinely interested in how things were going for us. Parking is available both on site and around the corner and down the side street. The hotel rates were very fair. We plan to return and stay with the Urbano family again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luapekralc
Reviews.Content: This was a good little hotel with a chic artsy look. Rooms were very clean, service was excellent, and the location was good. We enjoyed a drink by the pool sitting in front of a huge fire pit, and also a very good, reasonably priced, breakfast the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bigncuteEd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Urbano yesterday. Great location to drop your bags enjoy the pool, then go explore Miami. The SeaAquarium is right across the street. The pool area is ti=o die for very romantic at night. We decided to eat at the restaurant before we went out. This should be a local jem. Chef Anthony made us some great Tapas and the dessert was to die for. The chef amde these crabcake sliders that were delicate and awesome. He also made us some other plates as well that were just as good. We ended our dessert with a Nutella wwith bananas and chocolate in between a delicate Texas Toast OMG soooo good. We will return what a great spot from the different artwork throughout the Hotel to the food it will begetting very crowded soon. Great job

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing...............”
Reviews.Author: ninaslcpa
Reviews.Content: Cute boutique hotel - room was average - was supposed to be "city view" but all we saw was the road in front of the building and the overhang of the front door. Our balcony wasn't wide enough to accommodate a chair, which is probably why there weren't any out there. We went out for the day at about 9 a.m.. and when we returned at 3, our room had not been made up - we called the front desk and they said they would send someone up - seeing as we were headed back out, we said to wait 15 minutes until we left but 5 minutes later, the housekeeping staff is banging at the door - ! Location isn't very convenient - can't walk to ANYTHING - we had a rental car but of course, had to pay to park it. And $5 for a CUP of coffee is just outrageous (ditto for a $4 bottle of water that isn't even chilled)!!!!! The pool area is small but well appointed - however, on the evening we were out there, some private dinner was also going on (poolside) and we didn't swim because we didn't want to intrude on their celebration. Got to believe that there are better places to stay in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and accommodating staff."”
Reviews.Author: sstjohn2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urbano came recommended to me from a friend and we were completely surprised upon arrival. The location is perfect! It is located in the middle of almost everything without having to deal with all the traffic, US 1 is at the front door, the bridge to Key Biscayne is a simple turn and Interstate 95 is just a couple blocks away.
