The walls of the hotel are adorned with modern art and the rooms, decorated simply and clean. They have free internet, mini fridges and even gave us umbrellas to take for free when it rained! The pool was absolutely amazing, the perfect temperature and had plenty of seating area outside. A fire pit and a small waterfall really added to the ambiance. We encountered a couple minor problems with the room service and the telephones in the room but the staff was more than happy to help and took care of the issues for us. All of the employees of the hotel, especially Bryant at the front desk, were always positive and upbeat and ensured that we had a great trip. The valet people were always there to open doors for us and the bar staff was always friendly despite the fact all we ever ordered were espressos. I would recommend Hotel Urbano to anyone, it was a wonderful get away from the busy activities of our trip and we will certainly stay there again the next time we visit Miami!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain; quality; beautiful pool.”
Reviews.Author: Julaine
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Miami and decided this was our chance to enjoy a beautiful city and eat some Cuban food. Thanks to whoever on this site reviewed the Hotel Urbano. The cost of the room was under $100. Food and drinks were a little above average (or above our expectations), but it was good and plentiful. Hubby described the comfort of the bed and bedding as the best he'd ever experienced. However, after a while the down duvet was too hot and not necessary in a warm climate. Decor was clean and modern. Condition was almost brand new. If I have to criticize anthing at all, it would be the a/c in our room (#302) would rattle when it was operating and that woke me up. Also the door to the room next to ours squeaked when it was opened or closed and it sounded creepy at 5:30 in the morning. What???? The pool area is very lovely with cabanas, lots of chairs, flowers and even interesting sculptures all around. Trendy art in the hallways and public areas too. Not your cookie cutter chain hotel. A step or two better, in my opinion. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and I hope you'd be lucky to arrive when bellman, Michael, is on duty. Very helpful and friendly. He called us a cab to go to the Cuban restaurant in Spanish and then we used that cab driver for the rest of our stay. Wish I could give you the cab driver's name and number as he was great too. Tell everyone you know that this hotel is very new, very classy, small and personal, and priced unbelievably low for a major city like Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little Hotel Urbano-itâ€™s a gem !”
Reviews.Author: gben88
Reviews.Content: We researched a lot of hotels on this site-trying to decide whether to stay at Loews in South Beach, the Fontainebleau in Miami Beach or someplace that was convenient to all parts of southern Florida, as our objective this trip was to explore. And during Labor Day weekend both Loews and the Fontainebleau were sky high in pricing. Prices of course vary across the map-in Miami Beach you can pay big $$ for a lousy 50â€™s â€˜Art Decoâ€� hotel or decent $ for one that surprises you. Hotel Urbano is of the second category-casual South Beach style elegance with a staff the loves its hotel and who treats the guests who stay there very well. The staff makes this hotel, and they are very proud of their little hotel as they should be. While it isnâ€™t in Miami Beach proper, once you walk through the doors you donâ€™t care-a hotel this nice would cost 3 times the amount in South Beach. Hotel Urbano is south of downtown Miami about a mile, along the Biscayne Bay coast. Truth in advertising, itâ€™s 2 blocks away from I-95 and one block away from Rickenbacker Causeway, the main highway to Key Biscayne. Google map it and youâ€™ll see what I mean. The address of the hotel is 2500 Brickell Avenue, Miami, Fl. It is in a very nice and quiet neighborhood. No rooms face I-95 and the rooms that face south to Rickenbacker causeway are masked by some very nice foliage so you wonâ€™t see the expressway unless you get a east facing room, and then itâ€™s minimal as youâ€™d have to look pretty far to the right to see it. We came from the Miami airport, so from there, youâ€™ll travel I-95 to get here. Youâ€™ll see the Hotel Urbano sign to your right, once you get to 25th Road and Brickell. The entry is a small stone paved semi circle Drive. A bellman is available to park your car and bring luggage upstairs. The front desk area is small and right off the entrance. When you walk in youâ€™ll see the front desk to the left and a gorgeous view of a pool and cocktail bar straight ahead, as well as the dining room to the right. The signature of this hotel is its art-lots of original works, some for sale, in the South Beach eclectic fashionable style. Its clear someone put a lot of thought into its design and ambience. The front desk was very nice-we booked a King size city view, through our â€œI Preferâ€� Preferred Hotels guest program for $72 dollars a night with breakfast, using our Visa Signature card as this was their promotion with Hotel Urbano.. Anyone can do this on the Preferred Hotels website-it just gets you better deals than Priceline or Orbitz, and without the subhuman class treatment one gets booking through 3rd party websites. Our â€œcity viewâ€� room faced some non-descript apartment building to the east, overlooking the drive way into Hotel Urbano. We ordered some cocktails from the bar, and asked if we could be moved to a â€œpool viewâ€� room. Much better. Our first day here was the Sunday of Labor Day weekend and we were booked for 7 days. Had we been here Friday, I donâ€™t they could have upgraded us, but they had a lot of check-outs with the weekend ending so we got our â€œcomplimentary upgradeâ€�-second floor room . To be honest, you donâ€™t really see downtown Miami skyline from here-what you see above the palm tree line is 4 high rise residential towers to the north, and the furthest tower is about a Â½ mile from downtown, and the pool. The bellman moved everything to our new room while we went in to go have dinner in South Beach (about 8 miles away to the north and east). When we returned, everything-our bags and clothes were placed exactly as they were in the old room-impressive! Not only that but later we discovered one of our cell phones was left charging in the old room. No problem-the desk supervisor brought it up herself. So by then we knew we were also dealing with an honest, competent staff. We avoided the exorbitant $24 a night â€œValet parking feeâ€� by parking on the street. We had a Volvo convertible rental car and there were no problems parking Â½ block away. When you visit South Beach or Ft. Lauderdale, just be prepared for the sticker shock on drink prices-beers can be $6-$8 and Mojitoâ€™s $10 to $20. Some of them-especially on the Ocean Avenue happy hours-feel very watered down. And there are some tourist trap restaurants you want to avoid like the Carlyle (where the movie â€œThe Birdcageâ€� was filmed). Horrible food and service. I actually found the Trip Advisor restaurant forum to be very helpful. We found a fantastic Cuban restaurant called Yuca on the Lincoln Road Mall. through the Trip Advisor forum. This mall and Espanola Way in South Beach are fun to explore! The pool itself , at Hotel Urbano, is small. It goes from 3 feet to 5 feet in a matter of 30 feet or so. But they make the most of it with 4 cabanas, lots of chaise lounges and lush landscaping. Youâ€™ll even find palm trees that actually drop coconuts! Nice music piped into the pool area-very sophisticated. The pool and the room photos are exactly what you get when you get to Hotel Urbano-no website puffery there. This hotel reminds me a great deal of the Ambrose in Santa Monica-incredible once you get within the 4 walls, in a nice residential neighborhood, but driving distance to the beach. Here are some our our high points an low points for Hotel Urbano: Pluses- Free Hi speed Wifi throughout The staff-especially Erika, our breakfast server and bartender Breakfast Maid Service-itâ€™s excellent Fitness Room DÃ©cor Pool/Ambience In room safe, coffeemaker, Ipod docking station and flat screen TV Neighborhood Access to downtown, South Beach, Key Biscayne, Coconut Grove, Key West, Fort Lauderdale, the Miami Airport and Coral Gables is great! Minuses- The â€œservice chargesâ€� on every order Very slow kitchen The feeling in some places of an old Hampton Inn The price (and size) of the cocktails No baths-only showers Limited closet space The constant reference to Vizcaya by the management in the Trip Advisor posts- not everyone is interested in visiting Vizcaya In closing, Iâ€™ve been a Trip Advisor member for several years and once you get past the people who destroy hotels with their opinions because the didnâ€™t get an upgrade or one staff member treated them rudely, this is still a great forum. I take posts from people who have posted 10 or more times more seriously than single time postersâ€™. Most important is to Google Map any place you are looking at-especially in South Beach-Iâ€™ve never seen so much trick photography to make a hotel look bigger or better located than I have when we were looking to stay in Miami Beach. Iâ€™m glad we passed and we had plenty of money left over to enjoy the sights without breaking the bank. Hotel Urbano gets 4.5 out of 5 stars from us as a great small boutique alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Guest relantionship”
Reviews.Author: viajero292000
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is butique style hotel. From the bell boy too housekeeping verybody is really freindly and polite. They make you feel welcome, personal attention. The Restaurant has a good variety off Gourmet meals, everything is very clean. The room, is comfortable for one person, but if there are two, is pretty small, and there is hardly no place where too put the clothes, the bed and and leaning are very comfortable. Its good hotel, if one needs too do things around down town Miami, and souroundings fro 2 -3 days more than that do too the lack off storage it gets some what crouded.

Reviews.Title: “My Miami hotel of choice!”
Reviews.Author: kvbm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! It is clean, modern, and service oriented. I'm in Miami 3-4 times a year for work and will ONLY stay at Hotel Urbano! I know hotels as I've managed 5 in my career! They get it!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best service I have had at any hotel.”
Reviews.Author: blair1232
Reviews.Content: I have never been so pleased with a hotel in Miami. From the moment my friends and I entered the hotel to the time we left we were treated with excellent service. I visit Miami frequently because I live very close and most likley wont stay anywhere else but Hotel Urbano. The pool area is perfect for relaxing and getting sun! Also, if you go to the bar make sure you visit jeffrey!!!! He makes the best drinks and takes care of you.. I cant wait to go back..

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel but ......”
Reviews.Author: MJChile
Reviews.Content: Pros: Newly renovated, everything looks new. It is nicely decorated, very modern and stylish. Staff is very friendly Cons: The location is at a boring residential area Food is super expensive and average. Parking costs $28 dollars a night, and there is no option to park anywhere else around the hotel. Besides you DO need a car, the location is a dead spot, next to a mayor highway and there is nowhere to go within walking distance. It is around $30 dollars to take a taxi to south beach.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this sophisticated Miami hotel, and found it to be relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Rebec-PDX
Reviews.Content: This Miami hotel has just re-opened and had an art-deco theme. The service was excellent, and I liked the workout room and the pool cabana area. I thought the food was pricey, but because we were there after the opening, they were giving major discounts on the food. If I would have had to pay full price for the food, I would have gone elsewhere to eat. I chose this hotel because it was within walking distance of Vizcaya Villa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice botique hotel, clean, fresh and sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: rjhowells
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive the staff is attentive and very friendly. The lobby is done in a sophisticated south beach miami feel with art work from local artists adorning the walls. The rooms are very clean, fresh and very nice, plasma screen TV and comfortable bed. You will enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Brickell Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorraine6225
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night during a business trip. What a great hotel. Nice rooms, good service, cute restaurant. Really nice. The only bad thing is what they charge for parking, way too much. Also the Housekeeping staff stood outside my room speaking spanish very loudly, that was annoying. Otherwise I loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Miami”
Reviews.Author: jessero
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance went to Miami to celebrate his birthday. The hotel is the perfect location not far from shopping, fine dining, beaches and entertainment. The foyer sets a precedent for what your hotel stay will be like :) Loved the room, loved the service, loved the amenities. I can't say enough about this hotel but thank you for an unforgettable weekend getaway :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Recently renovated!”
Reviews.Author: rubbertoe
Reviews.Content: This was a GREAT deal! The hotel was just renovated. The paint was even wet in some hallways. The rooms were perfect. The pool area is VERY nice. The small workout room had brand new machines. The restaurant downstairs was very good and priced well for Miami. The hotel is very modern and well kept. The parking fee of $24 a day is a bit pricey, but worth it considering your room rate you can find online is under $100/ night. The location was excellent. Can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a gem!”
Reviews.Author: whatever16
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night for a quick getaway from Fort Lauderdale. A bit apprehensive when we pulled up, but boy were we proven wrong when we got in. An artsy, modern, chic little gem. Wonderful staff, beautiful artwork, clean rooms, lobby, bar and pool. Loved the cabanas at the pool with flat screen TV. No extra charge to sit in them. Food at their restaurant was excellent and not overly priced. Nice bar. Fire pit at night. Room was beautiful, clean and new. Bed was super comfortable. There is a $30 per night parking fee which my husband was not happy with.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay and right price, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: ldb61
Reviews.Content: Rate was very reasonable for clean, modern, comfortable rooms and pleasant common areas. The rooms had a mini refrigerator, flat screen TV, comfortable bedding and bathroom. The lobby level had two computers and a printer with no fees. wireless in the rooms worked very well. Original AAA rate was $99, then our group rate was even better rate at $89/night. Well worth even the $99. We only stayed for 2 nights and did not have a car. We tried to walk to a the a local pharmacy (about 15 minutes each way) but it was too hot so we gave up. The hotel restaurant was good enough and it was our only option for dinner upon our late arrival. The staff was very nice and honest, and did tell us that some guests get pizzas delivered from a local restaurant. The delivery menu was placed under our room door. Our room was on the 3rd floor and the 3rd floor also had a small fitness center. there were 3 fitness machines ( treadmill, bicycle and cross trainer) and some free weights. The fitness room had the vending machine with sports drinks, lemonade. Taxi to airport was about $24. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the stay and thought it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: slickvik69
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Hotel Urbano over Memorial Day Weekend due to the exorbitant prices of South Beach hotels over that holiday weekend. We got it for $109 a night per room, excellent deal for such a nice hotel, particularly in Miami. The hotel is located in a residential, quiet area of Miami called Brickell, a bit south of downtown. To get to downtown, we would just walk across the street and catch the B bus (48 runs only on weekdays) to 14th Street, and then hop on the MetroMover to take us around downtown. To get to south beach, we took the aforementioned MetroMover to Government Center and got on either the 120, C, or S bus which took us straight there. We would spend most of our time outside the hotel anyway so it's location wasn't an issue. We went to Bayside, South Beach, Jungle Island, etc. and when we were done made our journey back. As for the hotel itself, the service downstairs was outstanding, the people were very kind and nice. Also, the rooms were big and clean. Pretty much a four star hotel for a great price. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel! Perfect place to stay before our Cruise!”
Reviews.Author: RCB23
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 3 story hotel situated amungst the huge buildings along Brickell Ave! We booked our honeymoon very last minute (day before we left) and really picked this hotel as a place to sleep and a base for our suitcases before our cruise and we really scored! Much more than a place to sleep........very helpful staff, happy staff who say hello and actually want to help you, fantastic pool area with lots of comfy loungers and tables, fire pit with armchairs at night, great rooms which provide pool towels and stunning art everywhere. We arrived and as we only had 2 days in Miami before our cruise we hit the shopping mall asap. Hotel advised the best mall, opening times and arranged taxi - we were sent to the Aventura Mall and hotel advised nice places to eat in the mall. We hit the shops but because the hotel resturant was nice we decided to return to eat rather then pick up some food court food. Huge burger and ice cold corona sitting by the fire pit at the pool was exactly what we needed after a whole day flying from the UK and a whole night shopping in the mall (we got this level of service even at approx 11pm)!! Bliss! Next day we were advised again by the hotel to hit Ocean Drive, where Dash Miami was and to head to Lincoln road after Ocean Drive for more shopping - all advice was briliant and we followed everything they said and had a great Miami experience! That night we challenged the hotel to find us a glam, fabulous place to have dinner and drinks as we were on our honeymoon! The receptionist called many many many places to find us somewhere who 1. was open on a sunday night 2.allowed non residents and 3. super glam enough. She kept in contact with us and she did not give up until she found us something! Great service! She found us the Delano and drinks by the pool at the pool bar. If you know Miami, you know what an amazing job she did getting us in there for dinner on the patio! Transfer to our cruise was simple and the hotel arranged a flat rate taxi to take us to the port - all hassle free! Thanks to the Hotel Urbano we had a fantastic honeymoon! Our hotel which started as just a place to sleep turned out to be brilliant and actually made the Miami 2 day stay before the 7 night cruise as memorable as the cruise itself! Many thanks to Hotel Urbano from 2 very happy newlyweds xx

Reviews.Title: “Very disorganized front desk staff--poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: alejana
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from a stay at Hotel Urbano which is affiliated with Sterling Hotels. While the accommodations and the hotel grounds were very nice, the service is absolutely and undoubtedly subpar. We had difficulties from the time we arrived. Our reservation, which we had booked a month before directly through the hotel website could not be found. We did have a confirmation number and after some searching, it was located. We were told our room was not going to be ready until 3:00 pm (it was 1100am) but we could check in and leave our luggage. They swiped our credit card and all but they did not assign us a room. We came back to the hotel around 1100pm and were then told that one of the rooms was ready, but the other was not. For the other room not being available, several excuses were given. The first that it was not in the system (even though when it was finally found I did not have to provide my credit card or information again); the second, that we had shown up too late; the third, that they had water damage to some of the double rooms, that they had to be taken off line and that I would be given a room with a king sized bed and a sofa bed. When I expressed reservations about this arrangement, the front desk person simply said I could come and see the room and if was not to my liking I would be free to then make arrangements elsewhere. Seriously, at 1100 o'clock at night!! No apology was offered for the fact that if the rooms were truly out or order, it should have been mentioned at 1100 in the morning when we first arrived, not at 1100 o'clock at night. We were left wondering if the rooms were indeed out of order or if our room had simply been given away to someone else. My sister voiced a more forceful objection and they agreed to comp our breakfast the following morning. Between her and I, we switched rooms so my party of 3 went into the double room and her party of 2 took the king sized room. Sunday, the day of departure we stood in line for over 20 minuted to check out. The same guy from Friday night was there. When we reviewed the bill, we found we were being charged for valet on the bill for both rooms. We had traveled as a single party in one car even though we were split in 2 rooms. We explained this to the front desk person who did not take our word for it, but made us wait in line again until someone from valet came to vouch for our information. Check out took close to an hour!! Frustrated, my sister and I voiced our concerns regarding the poor organization and lacking customer service. The front desk employee became argumentative, deflected responsibility and we almost had to tell him to be quiet so he would listen to some constructive criticism we provided regarding how to make check in more streamlined for the customer as well as how to improve their customer service and customer experience. Although this hotel has good food, a great location and is nicely appointed, we will not stay there again and will not recommend it. Customer service is sorely lacking!

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco - Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ivette444
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is excellent. Staff is wonderful and very attentive. The food at the restaurant is delicious. The room is very clean and modern. The bathroom is confortable, spacious and very clean. There is art everywhere. I had a wonderful time. Tip: If you want to avoid parking charge, there is parking in the area.

Reviews.Title: “This place is dollar for dollar, THE BEST in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: tobinole
Reviews.Content: I had an absolute great stay at Hotel Urbano! It could be a little closer to Mid-Town and SoBe but it was literally a $5-$10 cab ride. Just let them know you need a cab about 10 minutes before you need it. As for the staff... SUPER FRIENDLY! Especially for Miami where we all know that hotel staff can be about as cold and stiff as any place in the world. They were coutreous, friendly, helpfull, and basically great. I'd highly suggest staying here if you need to stay in Downtown Miami or are looking for a CLEAN and BEAUTIFUL little spot to stay just minutes from SoBe. As for the Pool... no it's not that big but it's VERY nice and has great amenities. The rooms were super clean and decorated well. The bathrooms were very spacious as well. Over all, the hotel's decor was awesome. It's decorate dby local artists and the work for the most part is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: robfrombrooklyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, and they are still working some kinks out, but we will definitely stay here again. Comfortably sized room, comfortable bed, great food, good staff. Pros: food, bed, room, atmosphere, staff, pricing, comfort, location (if you do not want SoBe type atmosphere). Cons: location is by the highway, and it can be noisy (not inside the rooms, though), still have some glitches to work out. overall. we will return anytime to use this as a great place to see Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: FLTraveler777
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Food was great. Room service..great. Staff..great! Clean, modern rooms, excellent pool area, safe neighborhood. Internet, both wired and wireless. Very good connection. Its a bit hard to find if you are not familiar with the area and there isn't much within walking distance but this is one of the best hotels I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular stay!”
Reviews.Author: cali79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after hearing all the wonderful buzz., and I must say it did not dissappoint. The hotel is perfectly situated right on Brickell Avenue, the financial center of Miami. I was travelling on business, but the hotel is perfect for leisure travelers as it is near beaches, restaurants, and the exhilarating nightlife of Brickell and South Beach. The hotel has great service, exemplified by the staff going out of its way to accomodate my needs, even photocopying numerous documents througout my stay. Urbano truly provides an urban sanctuary, where all the days' stresses are immediately removed once you walk in. I would rate this hotel a 10 for the value,as the location, room, food and service are unmatched. Also, an added bonus top the location was a wonderful flower retailer next door where I was able to buy lovely flowers for my business contact, who was celebrating her birthday. I have stayed at numerous hotels in the nearby area, and this hotel is second to none, a true bargain! I recommend this hotel to all types of travellers, and I guarantee, you will leave with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL URBANO- the real deal”
Reviews.Author: skorpina6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in downtown Brickell Ave. not close to south beach- youll need a car or cab to get there- FYI- The rooms are very clean, very spacious, bathroom, very spacious. For that i give them an A. But, some things to watch out for: #1) The staff is clueless on just about everything- #2) do NOT be fooled by the pool photos or any "Lanai King Room"- there is NO LANAI- trust me. The hotel is next to a "dozen roses for sale"- classy :) Parking is on the street or 24$- but you CAN find parking on the street. Just watch those arrow signs. If you have no other choice, stay here, if not try another!

Reviews.Title: “Small place with a Big Punch”
Reviews.Author: raidaphan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only about 65 rooms give or take, however the location is perfect, pricing is reasonable and all employees are very friendly. The pool and landscaping makes you feel that you are secluded although you are on a major road. Since we stayed after they first opened, they had complementary breakfast, lunch, and dinner which was an amazing deal. We tried to eat breakfast, however the wait time was too long due to the fact that everyone wanted the free breakfast. We did however get a chance to have the dinner and it was AMAZING. Probably the best meal during our entire trip, and our waiter, Juan, gave the best recommendations. The hotel being new is very updated with a contemporary feel. The hotel rooms are small, but how often are you in your room while on vacation? I would definitely stay again. The only thing to note is that it is valet parking only, so you get a surcharge on your bill for everynight you stay of about 28 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this place!”
Reviews.Author: ba43
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this same building back in 2001 when it was another chain. I only remembered it's favorable location and nice neighborhood from that trip. So when I was in town recently looking for somewhere to stay near downtown, I decided to see if the old place was still around. Thankfully, that "old" place is history and the "new" Urbano is here. Wow! What a difference! I walk up to the lobby and I am greeted by a friendly doorman. As I enter and take in a decor that is modern and high class, I notice the various pieces of art on the walls. Sculptures greet you entering the swimming pool and patio area. There is fine art placed throughout the hotel and a visual feast awaits your discovery. The feast for your appetite is also taken care of with a fantastic complimentary breakfast, lunch and dinner!! Just leave a nice tip for your server. Food quality was outstanding by the way. Parking is an additional fee but it's valet service and you can come and go as you wish. Very convenient. The room we stayed in had fast Internet, lots of channels on an LG 42" plasma flat screen HD TV, a kingsize comfortable bed, terrazo floor in the large walk in shower, safe, closet space, iron, radio phone, desk, open balcony, nice carpet with modern design, etc. Best of all, the price we paid for this gem, including parking, was almost a hundred dollars less than all the hotels in the area we researched in advance!! The staff is nice, efficient and attentive. The entire experience was top notch and I would easily recommend this hotel. You won't be disappointed. Five out of five stars!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: luckygrl714
Reviews.Content: Hotel is newly remodeled and has a very modern feel. Art is located everywhere and is beautiful. Rooms were of good size, very clean, and had free internet. Business center had computers and free internet as well. We received all meals for free as part of a promotion and the food was simply amazing! All meals were of top quality and delicious. Staff was exceptional. The only bad part of this hotel is it is not located in close walking proximity to shops. If you have transportation or wish to take a taxi, it's just a short drive to many places such as Coconut Grove, downtown miami, Airport, etc. Located in a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Style & So. Beach Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: norman2
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this newly opened hotel on Brickell. The hotel has been renovated into a South Beach, urban oasis. The pool area is very nice, the lobby bartender very friendly. My room was nice. Comfortable bed, clean bath, great flat screen TV and internet. Overall, a nice experience, and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Urbano was a treat!”
Reviews.Author: lily01
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for work and flight was cancelled due to weather on East Coast. I needed to find a new hotel. It was the weekend of the boat show and most hotels were sold out or waaaaay overpriced. A local friend mentioned "urbano". I checked it out and called. They could not have been friendlier from my very first encounter. The reservations person told me to book on-line to get the best deal and so I did. I was at Urbano for 2 nights and had a lovely stay. I felt like I was family. I spend a fair amount of time in Miami for work and this hotel is convenient for driving and you can walk to places downtown and Mary Brickell square, (if you are used to walking places.) It is intimate and very clean-it helps that it is brand new. The staff was extremely friendly and could not wait to be helpful without being annoying. The pool area is cute but I did think the pool was a little cold in terms of temp. The restaurant/bar is in the lobby and is comfortable. Bar space is limited but restaurant is good size for hotel. I recommend for business or personal travel based on the excellent attitude of the Urbano staff!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Miami Brickell Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miami1981
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urbano I would most definietly recommend to any travelers looking for a relaxing and cool getaway. My friends and I were very impressed with the remodel of the Hotel and all the art work. The staff makes sure your needs are met and satisfied and were very friendly. The food was delicious especially considering that we were able to try most of the items because the hotel was offering free food the entire weekend (amazing). Its right next to Crandon Beach and a few block from Downtown. The pool lounge is intimate and cozy with the bar right next to it and very clean. Hotel Urbano was great.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Hotel Urbano”
Reviews.Author: HotelsFTW
Reviews.Content: Well when I walked in I was instantly welcome by Inay (front desk) greeting me with a warm smile she checked me in. The hotel is beautiful full of potential and color. The room i had was alittle small but not enough to change this great exprience. Great location its near coconut grove, downtown, and key biscayne. Bistro Urbano was amazing!!!!!!!! The best thing about the hotel is the service the entire staff is helpful. I had an issuse with the phone and Bryant (also front desk) helped me he was so nice and smart. The only bad thing is the size of the room and the room smelled alittle like paint but then again it is a new hotel. Bravo Hotel Urbano and your great service! I would also thank Inay, Bryant, and Evan

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Urbano
HotelInfo.Address: 2500 Brickell Ave, Miami, FL 33129
